title: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott Tests Positive for Covid-19
sub_head: The diagnosis comes as the state is experiencing a new wave of the virus
body:
AUSTIN, Texas—Texas Gov. Greg Abbott tested positive for Covid-19 Tuesday, his office said.
He was fully vaccinated against the virus and wasn’t symptomatic, his spokesman Mark Miner said.
“The Governor has been testing daily, and today was the first positive test result,” Mr. Miner said in the news release. “Governor Abbott is in constant communication with his staff, agency heads, and government officials to ensure that state government continues to operate smoothly and efficiently.”
Mr. Miner said Mr. Abbott is receiving Regeneron’s monoclonal antibody treatment and will isolate himself at home in the Austin Governor’s Mansion. His wife, Cecilia Abbott, tested negative. Mr. Miner said all close contacts of the governor had been notified. The positive test comes less than 24 hours after Mr. Abbott posted photos and video of himself at a packed Republican event in North Texas with hundreds of people.
Tuesday’s news comes as Texas is experiencing a new wave of the virus. Last Friday and Tuesday each saw more than 20,000 new cases of the virus confirmed, numbers that have been exceeded on only a handful of days since the pandemic began.. More than 12,000 people were hospitalized with Covid in Texas as of Monday, nearing January’s record of 14,000. Hospitals in several parts of the state have warned that they are full.
